Package agave

Serves as the main interface to Agave for a webapp developer, with the AgaveFilter serving as the Front Controller in a Model-View-Controller architecture, and several annotations to describe how handler methods will field HTTP requests.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Destination Represents the destination of a handler method.
InstanceCreator Creates instances of handlers and forms for use by the AgaveFilter.
LifecycleHooks Hooks into Agave's lifecycle.
MultipartRequest A request object that supports storage of multi-part information.
Part A part in a multipart/form-data HTTP post which either encapsulates a File upload or a String parameter.
 

Class Summary
AgaveFilter Scans the /WEB-INF/classes directory of a deployed context for any configured handlers, builds an internal representation of all handler methods, and then forwards HTTP requests to the handlers if they match the requested URI.
DefaultLifecycleHooks Stub implementations of all the lifecycle hooks.
Destinations A factory class for creating Destinations.
HandlerContext The context a handler runs in; where a ServletContext, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, and HttpSession are directly accessible.
 

Annotation Types Summary
CompletesWorkflow Indicates that the annotated handler method will complete a workflow.
ConvertWith Indicates which Converter to use.
HandlesRequestsTo Indicates that the annotated method is a handler method and fields requests to the URI named by the supplied value, relative to the context path.
InitiatesWorkflow Indicates that the annotated handler method will initiate a workflow.
ResumesWorkflow Indicates that the annotated handler method will resume a workflow.
 

Package agave Description

Serves as the main interface to Agave for a webapp developer, with the AgaveFilter serving as the Front Controller in a Model-View-Controller architecture, and several annotations to describe how handler methods will field HTTP requests. The HandlesRequestsTo annotation specifies the URI pattern that the handler method will field.

An example of a handler method:

public class FunHandler {
    @HandlesRequestsTo("/haveFun")
    public void haveSomeFun(FunForm funForm) throws ServletException, IOException {
        // wheeee!
    } 
}
